# watchTransactions() function

Watch for transactions to or from a given address.

## Example

```javascript
// this will log out the new transactions every time a new block is finalized
const unsubscribe = watchTransactions({
  network: "ethereum",
  address: "0x1234",
  onTransactions: (transactions) => {
    console.log("new transactions", transactions);
  },
});
// later on you can call unsubscribe to stop listening for new transactions
unsubscribe();
```

**Signature:**

```typescript
export declare function watchTransactions({
  address,
  onTransactions,
  ...sharedBlockParams
}: WatchTransactionsParams): () => void;
```

## Parameters

| Parameter                                         | Type                                                        | Description |
| ------------------------------------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------- | ----------- |
| { address, onTransactions, ...sharedBlockParams } | [WatchTransactionsParams](./sdk.watchtransactionsparams.md) |             |

**Returns:**

() =&gt; void

an unsubscribe function that will stop listening for new transactions when called
